intro: Qualea arirambae, commonly known as the Amazonian water tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the wetlands of the Amazon Basin. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and ability to thrive in waterlogged soils. The plant has broad, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms. Due to its unique adaptations, it is an essential component of the floodplain ecosystems in the Amazon.
